page.title: 07MAWGAN-IN-PYDAR CP SCHOOL
page.content: The school is situted in the centre of the village, between the Post Office and the River Menalhyl. The school was built 111 years ago. There are three classes, the infants class is in a temporary Elliot building. There are 84 children in the school. Children start school at 4\ years and transfer at 11 years to Newquay Treviglas Comprehensive School.23 children come by school bus from as far away as Trenance the rest live within walking distance of the school.Children wear school uniform in grey and green.The school day starts at 9am and finishes at 3.l5pm The classes study the usual subjects and often have projects using the Locality.There is a school netball and football team and an annual Sports Day is held.
